page.title: 16Ancient Jersey Customs
page.content:
William the Conqueror himself would have understood two of our{Jersey {customs}since they are{spoken in the {ancient Jersey_French}and were practised in his day.
The{loyal toast}in Jersey is not to Elizabeth our Queen but to Elizabeth our Duke (since Jersey was Willaim's property when he conquered England).
The{Clameur de Haro}(cry for help to Prince Rollo) is part of our Norman based laws . It is used to prevent someone instantly from doing you wrong (like chopping down your trees) until the case can be heard in the Royal Court.
